oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Biodiversity as a tool in crop nutrition
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Thorup-Kristensen, K.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Air and water emissions
Composting and manuring
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: In the abstract it is discussed how increased biodiversity in the choice of crops, catch crops and green manures can be used to improve organic crop rotations. Use of more species with variable characteristics can make it possible to make rotations with reduced losses of nutrients and improve nutrient supply for organically grown crops.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Thorup-Kristensen, K. (2005) Biodiversity as a tool in crop nutrition. Paper at: Ecosystem services as a tool for production improvement in organic farming - the role and impact of biodiversity, FiBL, Schweitz, April 2005.
